title: How To Decide Principles and Best Practices

placeholders.name: decision
placeholders.label: Decision or choice to evaluate (include goals, stakeholders, stakes, and any time constraints)

template: ## Objective
Guide the user to a defensible recommendation by classifying door type, exposing assumptions/biases, quantifying trade-offs, and defining next actions with monitoring hooks.
## Context
- Draw on Annie Duke’s How to Decide and Bezos’ one-way/two-way door framing.
## Inputs
- decision: {{decision}}
## Assumptions
Assumption: Ask ≤2 clarifying questions only if they could change classification or top option.
Assumption: Otherwise proceed and log assumptions.
## Constraints
- Keep reasoning concise and evidence-backed; cite the principle used.
## Instructions
1. Context scan — Objectives, stakeholders, stakes, constraints, timing (≤4 sentences).
2. Door test — One-way vs two-way with reversibility, time pressure, confidence.
3. Assumptions & bias risks — Table with confidence levels; tie to Duke/Munger/Kahneman with mitigation.
4. Options & outcomes — Table with upside, downside, most likely, trade-offs, safeguards.
5. Expected value — Likelihoods, pivotal uncertainties, value of more info.
6. Stress-test — Failure modes, safeguards, reversible experiments/staged bets.
7. Recommendation — Choice, rationale, triggers/metrics for reassessment.
## Execution Flow
1) Optional clarifying questions (≤2)
2) Perform steps 1–7
3) Emit output format
## Output Format
1. Decision Snapshot — 3–4 sentences covering problem, stakes, door type, reversibility window, decision horizon.
2. Assumptions & Confidence — Table: Assumption | Confidence (H/M/L) | Evidence/Gap | Bias risk & mitigation.
3. Options vs Outcomes — Table: Option | Upside | Downside | Most likely | Key trade-offs | Safeguards.
4. Expected Value & Sensitivities — Bullets summarizing likelihood-weighted view, pivotal uncertainties, and high-value tests.
5. Recommendation & Next Steps — Paragraph plus bullets for immediate actions, monitoring metrics, revisit triggers.
## Quality Checks
- Door classification explicit with justification.
- Assumptions include confidence, evidence status, and mitigation/test.
- Trade-offs balance qualitative and quantitative factors with cited principles.
- Recommendation includes next steps and revisit metrics.
- All assumptions/inferred data clearly labeled.
## Eval Stubs
- pass_if(has_door_classification == true)
- pass_if(assumptions_table_rows >= 3)
- pass_if(options_table_has_columns == true)
## Self-Check
If any Quality Check would fail, revise once before returning.
